intro: Doronicum tussilaginis, commonly known as the meadow thimbleweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with purple. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. Doronicum tussilaginis is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
